website_summaries.verdict: A good option for weatherproof motorcycle panniers perfect for off road riding.
pros: Outer material is made of UV-treated, waterproof tarpaulin PVC fabric that resists tearing and fading
Inside bag liner makes it easy to remove the interior contents quickly
cons: The top retaining straps for the upper lid are awkward to open quickly

customer_reviews.title: Huge bags, work great
customer_reviews.text: Fit great and work great on a Suzuki DR650 with some pannier racks. I’ve dropped the bike several times on very rough off-road terrain and the bags have held up with and without very heavy amounts of gear in them. I’ve ran lots of weight in camping gear and hauled it at a fast pace through rough rutted out off-roading with several lowside slides on the bike on slippery gravel. Not even a scuff after sliding the bulky bags on gravel. They are great bags and hold TONs of stuff but are HUGE and bulky. I’ve pressure washed them off at end of 3 day dirt rides. No water or dust got inside.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I've suffered from the clunky BMW hardbags that have deteriorated w/ time, limited in size, not waterproof, heavy, and costly to replace/repair. When my lever broke and I couldn't open one of the bags and learned it'd be nearly $200 to fix or replace, I searched for a reasonable replacement. Wow! These bags are cheaper, lighter, easy to install, waterproof, and enable much more storage! Can't lock them but have a lockable Givi topcase. And doubt anyone wants to figure out how to get into these bags or to steal them. If they do, I'll simple replace b/c the price/value is brilliant. I highle recommend these bags as a solution to carrying cargo whether around town or on trips.
customer_reviews.author: DBK

customer_reviews.title: Great saddlebags for day-to-day riding
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my adventure bike in place of the existing aluminum panniers. They're much lighter than the aluminum bags, and they're almost certainly safer (i.e. soft is better). The straps are really well designed, and I was able to attach these bags "securely" to my existing bag mounts/frames. In addition, I find them easy to open and close, and I'm impressed with the way they stay put at higher speeds. I'm going to keep these bags on my bike and just use my aluminum panniers for long highway rides. P.s. The yellow looks better than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bags at the right price
customer_reviews.text: I love how simple they are. Super secure mounting design and only a few straps to contend with. The right size, can rig them low on the bike. Nice connecting straps across the seat. A refreshing design when so many other manufacturers have one bazillion straps. I could've gotten soft luggage system, but I chose these for their simplicity. While these may shred in the event of a serious crash, you can always patch them with other waterproof PVC material of some sort, however, realize that gear could fall out since these don't rely on a tough inner waterproof bag like many systems. The material seems tough though so I'm not too worried. Very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Perfect For Long-distance Dual-Sport Riding
customer_reviews.text: Mounted to a 2018 Suzuki DR-Z400 (Precision Motorcycle Racks were also installed). I do multi-day, dual-sport rides, sometimes on fairly technical terrain. The soft saddlebags are great because you can brush your leg on them and they deflect (unlike hard-case bags). They tuck in nicely and can be mounted low to keep the center of gravity lower. I've scraped the bags on brush without any signs of wear or damage. They come with luggage bag inserts so you don't have to take them on and off every day. I haven't been in a downpour (or deep water crossing) but my stuff never got wet after riding in rainy conditions. The bags can be removed and attached without using tools.
customer_reviews.author: James Mcilvain

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for adventure motorcycling
customer_reviews.text: The metal buckles and sheer quality of these bags have set the bar for the rest of the adventure bag companies. I've owned Giant Loop (not waterproof from the factory) which is ridiculous considering what you pay, Dry Spec, and Dowco. These are hands down the best. Dry Spec are great but the plastic buckles are definitely the weak point. These mounted tight and secure on my F800GS using Dirt Racks luggage racks. Very well thought out system by Nelson Rigg!
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, sturdy and fits my BMW R9T
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After a few weeks, I am still really happy with these and I can add that they are not providing any air resistance at high speeds and easily fits for a one-person grocery shopping. Thry also hold their shape. Really good service. I needed it faster and they shipped right away. Pleasantly surprised over quality and how sturdy they are. Easy to install and fits well on my BMW R9T at a much lower price-point than the competition. The totes makes it possible for me to leave the saddlebags and just take the totes for grocery shopping.
customer_reviews.author: SillySally

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase for my uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for a motorcycle trip to Alaska this past summer. They held up well, kept everything dry, have some nice features and are as large as I would want saddlebags to be. They will see a lot more use including Costco runs on my scooter.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: meets needs of grocery shopping with rugged back country
customer_reviews.text: extremely pleased. installed with review of video several times. carries my groceries including a case of coke for each saddle bag plus some meat and vegetables and pasta or rice. remained dry inside through a tornado warning with severe thunderstorm. resists the rugged terrain of my offgrid homestead. my only worry is the velcro will wear out but time will tell... extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Channah

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am always pleased with Nelson Riggs items as they are all clearly built as heavy duty products. Extra reinforcements everywhere. I wish I had bought these a year ago. Lots of capacity, 100% waterproof, and easy to install. They probably have 2x the number of attachment points needed making them more secure and versatile. I've recommended to several of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Esther H. Streit

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because it's real waterproof. But main velcro-straps broken at the first off raod trip. Sleeping bag and coats loaded, no heavy weight
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great bags and a great company
customer_reviews.text: Great bags and a great company. These bags are as good if not better than the ADV name brand bags that are 5X as much. I have owned Nelson Rigg products that lasted 20 years. I have ridden motorcycles for 40 years and ADV for 15 in ybe southwest. My YouTube channel is youtube.com/azdesertdog
customer_reviews.author: azdesertdog on YouTube

customer_reviews.title: A very good value
customer_reviews.text: I installed these first on my KLR650 and ran them for about 3k miles. I found them to be quite good. Just installed a pair on my KTM 1090. Strap cleanliness can be a challenge I wish there was a better way to deal with the excess strap lengths when bags are not full. The price value can not be beat. Material quality is very good. They are absolutely water tight. The inner liner convenience bags are complete junk.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Good Soft Panniers
customer_reviews.text: I wanted soft panniers and these are relatively inexpensive and higher quality. I bought the rain covers designed Nelson-Rigg’s larger touring bags, and they fit just fine to keep buckles and straps from getting too muddy. These bags fit my BMW 1250GSA just fine and I would buy them again for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lescord

customer_reviews.title: Design needs work
customer_reviews.text: Pros, durable/heavy duty, waterproof, bright color. Cons, The two top straps that hold the lid down and give support are located way to far outside the stress zone where needed. They will slide over to the sides as the load grows larger rendering them about useless. The two photos of the bag while stuffed show the straps sliding further to the sides. Will have to add/mod with a pinch trap holding straps closer to center, may work?
customer_reviews.author: Yme

customer_reviews.title: Bag Stiffeners Do Not Fit
customer_reviews.text: The bag stiffeners will not fit and Nelson Rigg customer service sucks! They refuse to acknowledge that my bag stiffeners will not fit my bags. Extremely disappointed with this product and Nelson Rigg.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteKnight

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I own a 2017 Africa twin. Bought these to go on a trip from orange county up to half moon bay along hwy 1. I got stuck out in the rain by Solvang and the bike low sided during a low speed turn on something slick. Bag got a little scraped and the plastic buckled. I had my laptop in the bag and it was still ok! Very impressive because the Africa Twin curb weight is 506.8 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great for any bike with side racks or can hang free if bike permits.
customer_reviews.text: Name brand product with I suspect great customer support. Have not needed it. Clear instructions. Yellow color I chose is another layer of visual safety support. You can't go wrong with this setup. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence E. Cann

customer_reviews.title: Great value & great capacity
customer_reviews.text: I've not used these too much, but so far I'm very impressed. They mount easily & give a lot of options for attaching to racks or using without. The included inner bags are very handy for packing.
customer_reviews.author: climberevan

customer_reviews.title: Great saddlebags for my Yamaha WR250R!
customer_reviews.text: These saddlebags are great especially for the cost! I love all of the features: inner bags included, all metal hardware, waterproof and durable. Looking forward to packing them up with camping gear!
customer_reviews.author: Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these side bags for my 2017 Honda CRF 250L to do some desert and forest riding along Arizona BDR. They have served me well with providing great storage along with ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: LA.Branson

customer_reviews.title: Truly waterproof and nice. I have learned my lesson and highly recommend ...
customer_reviews.text: Truly waterproof and nice. I have learned my lesson and highly recommend that you protect the bottom edges somehow or they will quickly be ruined by hitting brush etc.
customer_reviews.author: glenn fisher

customer_reviews.title: For the money they are great
customer_reviews.text: Work great supposed to fit the tusk pannier racks but seems to me the bags are a tad bit wider but still works fine they dont hold their shape as well as the pictures advertise when empty but for the price great bags
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Solid, simple, waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These are great on my DRZ 400 for running errands and going groceries shopping. I can fit about 4 small bags of groceries in them with the tops rolled up. Bigger items can still fit because the straps are really long and can be fastened over the top. The bags have a nice stiffener in them. These replaced an old set of Ortlieb bags I had. The the quality is decent, especially for the price, and I'd have no issues taking them on a long trip. I have them mounted on Dirtracks pannier racks and they ride super stable.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Bags that exceed my expectations
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far, fit is excellent stiffeners inserted without issue. So far these are looking great and have excellent features for the price.
customer_reviews.author: versaguy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Once you have it on your frames for the bike it works good the buckles are a little funky to manage but they are sufficient
customer_reviews.author: Bwana

customer_reviews.title: For the money you can't beat these bags
customer_reviews.text: Vary good for the money. I had them on my duel sport for the winter in the Colorado Rockies and everything but one strap held up probably something I did honestly good product
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas R

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bags
customer_reviews.text: Have not had a chance to use them on a trip, but have used a top bag from Nelson Rigg on my last BDR through Colorado, I think the quality is just as good as the other name brand for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Easy to install, great for trips. I use a lot of extra rope to secure them, but works for what I need. Not heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Kulik

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Seem pretty decent. Took on a 2500 mile trip mostly dirt, dumped a few times and they held up just fine. Hard to get set up right and the strap is uncomfortable to sit on and doesnt want to fit under the seat. Started to sag on my pannier racks after a few days and didnt really retain the shape. Probably longer racks would work better
customer_reviews.author: T  V

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality. Better than some of the other name brands.
customer_reviews.text: I put these on the KLR and used them on the 5000 mile trip. I did some singletrack and tried to take down a tree. The tree lost yet I did lose some stitching on one spot. I was super impressed of the bags. They were quite large. I would take them over some of the other name brands that I saw on other friends bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Beckner

customer_reviews.title: Not worth what I spent on them
customer_reviews.text: The strap broke immediately....I now need to buy an entier new set! Going elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: theseolddreams

customer_reviews.title: Large and dry.
customer_reviews.text: Nice large bags. No water at all in them. Fits my klr650 well. I have bag racks. Only wish they had some outer pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdogchet

customer_reviews.title: kinda of a pain at first but great
customer_reviews.text: i have use these bags for few months no on sevral overnight trips i wish the buckle system was easier but other then that there perfect
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: God tier storage for a bike
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been happier with a purchase. The Inner lining for the bags makes packing so simple I went on a two week trip on my KLR with these and had a blast the entire time, my friend spent more on his soft bag solution and remarked how much he wished his was more like mine the second time his bags fell off mid ride
customer_reviews.author: "lizard2k"

customer_reviews.title: Really like these panniers
customer_reviews.text: Roomy, waterproof, rigid, easy to put on. Lots of space. Well priced.
customer_reviews.author: Vinicio

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I won't be going back to hard bags. These are the perfect size my DL 650. They go on easy and secure well. I recommend using these with racks
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Carter

customer_reviews.title: I could recommend these to people.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these saddle bags. Keeps everything dry even in heavy rain. Only gripe is that it’s a pain having to use all the straps every time you open and close them. Also some of the straps have a lot of excess strap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ARRIVED DAMAGED...seriously
customer_reviews.text: These panniers arrived ALREADY DAMAGED as you can see in the photo. I'm giving 1 star for the complete lack of quality control. If the company makes it right I'll revise my review because other than this blatantly obvious mistake, they seem decent.
customer_reviews.author: Alexnder Kristelle

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. It survived my last ride
customer_reviews.text: The product is of good quality and best bang for the buck. Lightweight and Durable. It survived my last adventure ride through the Wa BDR.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Loaded up nicely on my dr650 survived the top of the world gravel highway to dawson Canada to chicken Alaska. Dropped it a couple of times on dirt single track all held up great no issues been using them every morning to commute to work and doing great still water tight.
customer_reviews.author: alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great soft bags for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Really like these bags. Waterproof and sturdy and liners included. Metal buckles and pretty easy on/off. I have them on my Versys X300.
customer_reviews.author: SGinOR

customer_reviews.title: Proven sidebag for all terrains, delivery for international shipping is superfast
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for over than 13000 km in one year through many different terrains in Indonesia, through mud, rain and very hot days. No crack, no leaks, all is good. Got a second one for a friend who switch from hard panniers to soft panniers.
customer_reviews.author: VinS

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit on my Dual sport motorcycle.
customer_reviews.text: OMG! what a nice bag! Use them on my WR250R duel sport and they are awsome.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly on Tusk pannier rack, They take forever to get into and out of, the G clips require two hands to latch and unlatch. They don't hold alot, but hold what's in there very securely. Some external pockets or a way to add them would be great. My bike is the Africa Twin.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Bargain and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been impressed. Lots of space and it fits my Janus Halcyon well. I've used these for grocery shopping with good results. Thd only issue is getting fitted just right.
customer_reviews.author: recumbenteer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased less than a year ago, Aug 2019. Bag started to separate at seam and mounting strap ripped from bag for no apparent reason. Cloth Bag inside zipper wasn’t sewn properly and zippers cane off. Waste of money to doubt. Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip V. Morzark

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy bags!
customer_reviews.text: Love these bags! They are perfect because they are waterproof and the bags inside the bags make it easy to grab what you need off your bike and go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome form my motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and they have a thing to put in the to keep their shape. I used them for a Moto camping trip and they were great. I’m so glad I didn’t buy solid panniers.
customer_reviews.author: james lally

customer_reviews.title: Best value out there.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag set. I modified mine for a permanent set up so not sure how easy they are to install normally. But for the money these can’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item
customer_reviews.text: Great bags! Durable, great size, exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Musick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my G650GS Sertao and looks great. Easy to install, to pack. First trip ahead but promising.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bags!
customer_reviews.text: Great bags, love the removable inner bags. All the buckles, connectors ect... are metal. They are very roomy and truly water proof. I mounted mine backwards by accident, didn't really matter. Price was high but I think these are the best bag of this type you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Texcl

customer_reviews.title: Great for all season.
customer_reviews.text: These are great but they could use an outside pocket. They’re a little cumbersome to get in and out of, but they are totally waterproof. Disappointed that they don’t have a heat resistant panel on the bottom like some others.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These bags seem really durable and i look forward to testing the water proofing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Boughal

customer_reviews.title: Just received it. There are supposed to be 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received it. There are supposed to be 2 inside pockets for the stiffeners. one of the bags is defective and has only one... would expect Nelson Rigg to pay more attention before shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Nelson-Rigg SE-3050-YEL Sierra Dry Saddlebags 100% Waterproof Mount to most Adventure and Dual Sport Motorcycles, Yellow
product_meta.description: Color:Yellow/BlackLIFETIME . All saddlebag mounting hardware is aircraft grade aluminum. NO breakable plastic buckles. 100% waterproof motorcycle saddlebags, All seams are electronically heat welded. Includes 2 lightweight saddlebag liners to easily remove and pack contents. Removable stiffeners allow the saddlebags to hold their shape when empty. Firm internal back plate helps support saddlebags. Replaceable pads helps protect saddlebags from rubbing on your motorcycle rack. Compression straps can also be used to mount optional Nelson-Rig dry roll bags. Each saddlebags securely mounts to your motorcycle using 4 quick release cam buckles and double pull straps. Made from waterproof and durable 24oz tarpaulin PVC. UV Coated outer material cleans easily. Easily mounts to Motorcycles, PWC and snowmobiles. Available in Black (SE-3050-BLK), Yellow/Black (SE-3050-YEL). Main compartment measures: 15"L x 8"W x 14"H. Holds 27. 53 Liters per side.
feature_bullets: 100% waterproof motorcycle saddlebags, all seams are electronically heat welded
All saddlebag mounting hardware is aircraft grade aluminum. NO breakable plastic buckles
Each saddlebags securely mounts to your motorcycle using 4 quick release cam buckles and double pull straps
Includes 2 lightweight saddlebag liners to easily remove and pack contents

specifications.Special Features: Aircraft Grade Aluminum, Electronically Heat Welded Seams
specifications.Vehicle Service Type: Street-touring-motorcycles, Street-sport-motorcycles, Marine-personal-craft, Street-cruiser-motorcycles, Snowmobiles, Utility-vehicles
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars168 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
